summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice contract (order number 15JA5421F00000068) with CACI, Inc. for scanning and document management services related to the case 'U.S. v. Maxwell Epstein'. The contract outlines the scope of work, confidentiality requirements, and data security protocols for handling sensitive case materials. This document is a list of standard federal contract clauses (GS-25F-0131M) for a GSA Schedule contract with CACI, INC. - COMMERCIAL. It is an administrative attachment detailing compliance requirements, not a document directly related to the Epstein case narrative.

persons.name: Maxwell Epstein
persons.context: The case referenced in the contract title is 'U.S. v. Maxwell Epstein', indicating she is a defendant or subject of the legal proceedings for which document scanning services are being procured.

keyFacts: The U.S. Department of Justice contracted CACI, Inc. to scan and manage documents for the case 'U.S. v. Maxwell Epstein'.
The contract involved digitizing 25-40 bankers boxes of mixed paper and electronic evidence, indicating a large volume of discovery material.
The contract included stringent confidentiality and data security clauses to protect sensitive law enforcement information and personally identifiable information (PII).
The work was to be performed under the GSA schedule contract GS-25F-0131M, with a total award amount of $26,639.04.
The document specifies technical requirements for the digitization, including 300 dpi TIFF files, OCR text extraction, and Concordance/IPRO litigation support formats.
Document is a list of standard federal acquisition regulation (FAR) and GSA clauses for a government contract.
The contractor listed is CACI, INC. - COMMERCIAL under contract number GS-25F-0131M.
The document is purely administrative and contains no narrative, names, or events related to Jeffrey Epstein or his associates.
Clauses cover standard government contracting topics like pricing, labor standards, ethics, and compliance.
This appears to be an attachment from a larger document set, possibly related to government procurement records.
